result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

addressed to: Jesse J Lopez for hearing on December 16, 2022 
Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward.
Pre-trial conference on December 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:35 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J Lopez in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Jesse J Lopez.  Atty. Nimmer provides an update; she is working with the State on resolving the matter.  Atty. Nimmer requests another further proceedings date in about 60 days or set on the pretrial calendar as she believes this matter should be pretrial eligible.  State confirms the matter is pretrial eligible, even though there is a victim, and has no objection to the matter being set on the pretrial calendar.  Court will put the matter on the pretrial calendar.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:43 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jesse J Lopez in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia, for attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Tapia advises Atty. Nimmer is asking the matter be set for another further proceedings as she is still working on getting discovery.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
